total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the pattern in the transformation of the input grid to the output grid in the examples.
Q2: Notice that the output grid is three times the size of the input grid in both dimensions.
Q3: Observe that the original input grid is repeated three times both horizontally and vertically to form the output grid.
Q4: Identify the transformation of the 0s in the input grid to 2s in the output grid.
Q5: Notice that the 2s in the output grid are located in the first column of each repeated input grid.
Q6: Identify the transformation of the non-zero numbers in the input grid to the same numbers in the output grid.
Q7: Apply these transformations to the input grid of the quiz to generate the output grid.

Q3: Observe that the original input grid is repeated three times both horizontally and vertically to form the output grid.
Q4: Identify the transformation of the 0s in the input grid to 2s in the output grid.
Q5: Notice that the 2s in the output grid are located in the first column of each repeated input grid in the output grid.
Q6: Identify the transformation of the non-zero numbers in the input grid to the same numbers in the output grid.

Q1: Identify the pattern in the transformation of the input grid to the output grid in the examples.
Q2: Notice that the output grid is three times the size of the input grid in both dimensions.
Q3: Observe that every cell in the input grid is replicated three times in both dimensions in the output grid.

Q4: Identify the rule for transforming the value of each cell in the input grid to the corresponding cells in the output grid. Notice that the cells with value 0 in the input grid are transformed to 2 in the output grid, and the cells with other values are replicated as they are.
Q5: Apply the transformation rule identified in Q4 to each cell in the input grid of the quiz to generate the output grid.
